title: Nikki Glaser Expands 2025 “Alive and Unwell Tour”
description: There will be 17 new shows in cities including Boston, New York, Toronto, Austin, and Chicago. Nikki Glaser Expands 2025 “Alive and Unwell Tour” Eddie Fu
author: Eddie Fu
excerpt: Nikki Glaser has expanded her 2025 "Alive and Unwell Tour" with 17 additional North American standup shows.
text: Coming off a highly-praised turn as this year’s Golden Globes host, Nikki Glaser has expanded her already massive 2025 “Alive and Unwell Tour.” Our 2024 Comedian of the Year has added 17 new North American shows in cities including Boston, New York, Toronto, Austin, and Chicago. See the full schedule below, with new dates designated in bold. Get Nikki Glaser Tickets Here An artist pre-sale (code: UNWELL) for the newly announced dates goes live on Wednesday, January 22nd ahead of the general on-sale slated for Friday, January 24th via Ticketmaster. For all other dates, fans can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out shows via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand. Earlier this month, Glaser did a morning-after appearance on The Howard Stern Show following the Golden Globes and revealed a dozen jokes that were left on the cutting room floor. Read our year-end interview with the comedian. html:
Coming off a highly-praised turn as this year’s Golden Globes host, Nikki Glaser has expanded her already massive 2025 “Alive and Unwell Tour.”

Our 2024 Comedian of the Year has added 17 new North American shows in cities including Boston, New York, Toronto, Austin, and Chicago. See the full schedule below, with new dates designated in bold.

Get Nikki Glaser Tickets Here

An artist pre-sale (code: UNWELL) for the newly announced dates goes live on Wednesday, January 22nd ahead of the general on-sale slated for Friday, January 24th via Ticketmaster.

For all other dates, fans can look for deals or get tickets to sold-out shows via StubHub, where orders are 100% guaranteed through StubHub’s FanProtect program. StubHub is a secondary market ticketing platform, and prices may be higher or lower than face value, depending on demand.

Earlier this month, Glaser did a morning-after appearance on The Howard Stern Show following the Golden Globes and revealed a dozen jokes that were left on the cutting room floor. Read our year-end interview with the comedian.
